sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The European Commission has invited member states to come back to budgetary discipline, which means gradually leaving behind the period of generous spending of the previous crisis years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The legally binding rules compel EU states to keep their public deficit below 3% and their debt-to-GDP ratio below 60%, thresholds that many currently exceed by a significant margin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: That's why the EU Commission will let countries an important margin of flexibility in how they reduce their public debt in the medium term meaning in four to seven years. But this support cannot continue indefinitely so the time for broad-based fiscal stimulus has passed. It's time to shift gear and look to the future. In the spring the Commission will give each country a spending target for 2024 in line with their own fiscal plans.
